meanings.definition: Gratinees (verb): to cook or brown food with a topping of breadcrumbs and cheese in the oven.
meanings.sent1: She gratinees the macaroni and cheese for a delicious dinner.
meanings.sent2: The chef gratinees the lasagna to perfection every time.
meanings.sent3: The oven was surprised when it was asked to gratinees the vegetables.
meanings.sent4: Her love for cooking shines through as she gratinees the casseroles.
meanings.sent5: The aroma of gratinees dishes filled the kitchen with warmth.

meanings.definition: Gratinees (adjective): having a browned or crispy topping of breadcrumbs and cheese.
meanings.sent1: The gratinees potatoes were a hit at the potluck.
meanings.sent2: The gratinees chicken had a crunchy texture that everyone loved.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to steal a bite of the gratinees pizza.
meanings.sent4: The gratinees breadsticks glistened under the restaurant lights.
meanings.sent5: The gratinees crust on the pie added a delightful crunch.

meanings.definition: Gratinees (noun): a dish that has been cooked or browned with a topping of breadcrumbs and cheese.
meanings.sent1: The gratinees on the menu caught her eye immediately.
meanings.sent2: The potluck featured various gratinees, from casseroles to desserts.
meanings.sent3: The family argued over who would get the last piece of the gratinees.
meanings.sent4: The restaurant's specialty was the seafood gratinees.
meanings.sent5: The holiday feast included a variety of gratinees dishes.
